page.title: Welcome Player
page.p: This book you have in your hand is here for you. To make your life easier and give it some direction.
If you prefer Quest based guide it is also part of this modpack. You can use the Better Questing Shortcut or open the Quest Book.
good luck, Darai
Links
There are some very important points you should know:
There is also this chapter which can guide you through the whole modpack if you want.
The Goal
To complete this modpack (if you need a final task for a sandbox game) you must build your spaceship and reach the orbit of the Mooshroom Moon.
Next to it is a small moon called Haven. Terraform it and build there a monument of your success.
For the monument, use at least following resources:
Optionally you can prove yourself by crafting the most expensive thing in this modpack:

page.title: Why not just Quests?
page.p: You can easily get lost in quests. So, the most important topics are available also here.
Also some people despite quests all together and I want this to be fun also for them.
The most important chapters like "Where to look for resources" or "What can kill you" are also described in the Quest Book.
Wrong Recipes not so much...
Also It is much easier to write this guidebook, so it will be completed in version one of the modpack and the Quest Book will not.

page.title: Dumb ways to Die
page.p: There are few things in this pack which can easily and quickly kill you. Or at least kill your mood.
Some people do not like this so here is all the warnings I could think of.
Swimming
Deadly fast and living in all Homeworld oceans. That is Piranha.
Beware, they can jump from the water if you stand too close.
Spice of Life
Keep your food list rich. Everything you eat will loose it's effectiveness very quickly.
Moving the World
Big part of this modpack is Davinci's Vessels which allows you to turn some blocks into ship/airship and fly them.
Beware, even though this mod is great, it can crash the game. Play it safe and make yourself accustomed to this mod first.
Know death causes:
Flat ship with Helm close to water. Beware Piranha.
Parking ship on Flowing Water. You will loose it.
Ship without means to climb on it.
Ship without enough fuel.
Falling into Void
Some places are dangerous to land in. Namely Asteroid Worlds, The End Ocean and Lava Worlds.
On all those places, you can easily loose your rocket on landing attempt with everything on-board. Be prepared for it and have all the spare parts in your pocket.
Portals
Portals are DANGEROUS. You may materialize inside a wall or in the air above a lavapool. Carry material for a spare portal.
Craft a specific ITEM to unlock a portal, make the portal out of the correct BLOCK and activate it with the correct IGNITER.
Item, Block and Igniter:
For UnderEnd:
For The Nether:
For The End is enough to unlock it. To get there use a rocket, it is a moon orbiting the Blue Gas Giant.
Monsters
To make the game more fun I tweaked the monsters a little bit. And to make it even more fun, I tweaked them differently on every planet.
So, don't be that much surprised, ok?
Warp
I will not explain to you how a warp engine works. But there is one thing specific in this pack.
You need to put into the Warp Controller the correct World Orb, before you will be allowed to warp.
Every planet has it's own orb, with consistent-ish name.
Not like moons, once you are orbiting a planet you can use rocket to get to any moon it has.
As it is now, to get to every next planet, you need to find resources, which are specific to the previous planet, first. This is the correct sequence of World Orbs:

page.title: Messed-up Recipes
page.p: If you don't know... I changed A LOT of recipes. JEI caught most of the changes but as I understand not all of them.
So about some things, it will be telling you that such receipt exists and it will not be true.
Here is the list of what is the JEI lying about:
Charcoal
Forget burning logs in a furnace. Charcoal can be now made only in the Forestry Charcoal Pit.
For those who don't know what that is, you build a pyramid of Loam with Piled Wood in it, light it up and wait.
Also Charcoal is now the only fuel source for making Coal Coke and ultimately burn Iron to Steel.
Tinkers Book
Records in the Tinkers Manual are unfortunately hardcoded so our changes to Material Harvestability are not there reflected.
Namely Early materials, Duranite, Eezo, Ovium and Abyssum were tinkered so they are easy minable.
Harvestcraft Machines
I installed JEI addon for those, but in case it is still missing something:
Pressed can be Combs, Soy things, Fruits and some Nuts.
Smelting
I removed smelting of all Sharpening Kits. Since I tweaked their recipes I put it in as the proper fix.
Carpenter and Thermionic Fabricator
JEI is remembering all the recipes, old ones and new ones. So expect, that the easier recipes for Electron Tubes and Forestry Circuits do not work.
Only those using Silicon are valid and working.
RS Solderer
Refined Storage Solderer recipes are completely wrong. JEI just gives the original list without my changes. So here is what is different:
And now the new and better recipes:
Empowerer
Empowerer JEI is not showing power requirements. You will have to figure it yourself.
Nihilite Alloy
Nihilite can be alloyed only in the Chemical Reactor now.
Nihilite Ingots and Blocks can be made in Alloy Smelter or from the fluid Nihilite alloy in the casting basin. But they cannot be re-melted to obtain the alloy fluid back.

page.title: Looking for Resources
page.p: For hardcore players ...
... Figure IT OUT :)
For all of you who don't like to wander without knowing what you are looking for, here is what deposits are where. It is important, believe me, there is a lot of ground to cover.
Do not continue reading if you want to try THE HARDCORE WAY.

page.title: Homeworld
page.p: Your starting planet is one big ocean full of islands.
Under every island (based on the biome) is different ore mix. Here are the varieties.
Everywhere
Some ores are present under the whole Homeworld surface.
Redstone [0-16]
Copper [30-120]
Iron [0-30]
Duranite [0-10]
Aluminium [30-50]
Basalt [0-50]
p. Iron [0-64]
p. Gold [0-32]
p. Copper [40+]
p. Tin [40+]
p. Silver [10-42]
p. Nickel [30-60]
Forrest Islands
Aluminium [40-120]
Copper [30-120]
Flower Forrest Islands
Copper [30-120]
Jungle Islands
Nickel [30-50]
Lapis [5-25]
Swamp Islands
Redstone [0-16]
Aluminium [40-120]
Desert Islands
Saltpeter [50-80]
Redstone [0-16]
Emerald [40-130]
Diamond [5-25]
Savanna Islands
Nickel [30-50]
Aluminium [40-120]
Iceberg Islands
Gold [5-35]
Osram [0-10]
Silver [20-55]
Hills Islands
Diamond [5-25]
Emerald[40-130]
Lapis [5-25]
Sulfur [5-30]
Taiga Islands
Osram [0-10]
Aluminium [40-120]
Gold [5-35]
Diamond [5-25]
Messa Islands
NETHERRACK !!
Quartz [10-150]
Gold [5-35]
Lapis [5-25]
Silver [20-55]
Prometheum [2-45]

page.title: Planets
page.p: Let's put here everything your rocket can land on.
The Moon
Moon is your closest and easiest target.
Deposites of Iron, Gold, Redstone, Lapis, Emeralds, Aluminium, Copper, Tin, Zinc, Nickel, Osram, Basalt and Silver. Also Meteorite and Karmesine.
Asteroid Belt
Belt is the second Moon of your HomeWorld Giant. But before you go there here is small warning.
It is an Asteroid Belt. It can easily happen, that your rocket will not hit any land and just disappear into the space. But sooner or later, you will have to go there anyway. So Good Luck.
Deposites: Iron, Gold, Redstone, Lapis, Diamond, Aluminium, Copper, Tin, Basalt, Titanium, Silver. Also Cobalt, Ardite, Magma and Nether Quartz.
Lava World
Closest planet to the Sun, Very Hot and Hostile.

Small deposits of Redstone, Aluminium, Copper, Tin, Zinc, Nickel and Dilithium. Large deposits of Iron, Gold, Lead, Eezo, Basalt, Silver and Karmesine. Also Meteorite, Apatite, Titanium and Osram. Neherrack, Tiberium, Cobalt, Ardite and Nether Quartz.
Alien World
Almost pleasant world.

Small deposits of Iron, Gold, Copper, Tin, Lead, Eezo, Osram and Silver. Large deposits of Redstone, Lapis, Diamonds, Emeralds, Aluminium, Zinc, Nickel, Basalt, Karmesine and Duranite. Some Coal, Ovium and Draconium. Meteorite, Apatite, Iridium and Osram.
Crystal Moon
This moon is orbiting the Alien World Planet, so it has the same World Orb.

Natural Growth of Crystal Block Spires. Small deposites of Iron, Gold, Redstone, Aluminium, Copper, Tin, Zinc, Lead, Eezo, Ovium and Glowstone. Large deposites of Lapis, Diamonds, Emeralds, Black Quartz, Nickel, Osram, Meteorite and Karmesine.
Sand Moon
It orbits the Mystical Gas Giant, so it requiresthe Mystical World Orb.

Small deposits of Aluminium, Copper, Tin, Zinc, Nickel, Ovium and Basalt. Large deposites of Iron, Gold, Redstone, Diamonds, Osram, Silver and Coal. Also Meteorite, Black Quartz, Tiberium, Cobalt, Ardite, Nether Quartz, Soul Sand,...
... Also Uranium, Uru, Glowstone, Titanium and Prometheum can be found here.
The End
It orbits the Mystical Gas Giant, so it requires the Mystical World Orb. Large deposit of endstone, draconium, dragon hearts, dragon eggs and chaos shards.
Beware, Chaos Guardian Included.
Distant World
This is your first planet from the Beta Star System. It requires the Distant World Orb or a Gateway through the Nether.

Small deposites of Iron, Redstone, Lapis, Zinc, Nickel and Basalt. Large deposits of Gold, Diamonds, Emeralds, Lead, Eezo, Osram, Silver, SoulSand an Uranium. Also Coal, Dilithium, Jauxum, Magma, Netherrak and Valyrium.
Ocean World
It requires the Ocean World Orb.

Small Deposites of Gold, Diamonds, Emeralds, Zinc, Lead, Nickel, Eezo and Silver. Large deposites of Iron, Redstone, Lapis, Aluminium, Copper, Tin, Osram, Basalt and Duranite. Also Coal, Ovium, Vibranium, Iridium and Titanium.
Rocks In Sky
It orbits the Ocean World, so it requires the Ocean World Orb. It is an Asteroid Belt, so beware of the landing hazard.
Deposits of Iron, Gold, Redstone, Lapis, Emeralds, Aluminium, Copper, Tin, Zinc, Nickel, Titanium, Silver, Cobalt, Ardite, Nether Quartz and Prometheum.
Mooshroom World
It orbits the BlueBall Gas Giant. But it is so important that the World Orb is named by this world, not the Planet. Mushroom World Orb.
Deposits of Aluminium, Copper, Tin, Redstone, Lapis, Nickel, Eezo, Osram, Basalt, Black Quartz, Jauxum, Uru and Aurorium can be found here.
The Haven
This is the moon for your Victory Monument. It has No Ores, it just waits for your work.

page.title: Dimensions and Extra
page.p: Here is every place into which you can get only by a portal.
Or just get resources there with no access "In Persona".
Well in the case of the Distant World it is not only... but it is a portal anyway.
The UnderEnd

Maybe you noticed that to get into space, you are missing some End-Ores. Well the End is a moon orbiting 4th planet of the Alpha Star so no, you cannot go there yet. But you can go to the UnderEnd. That is an End-like dimension deep under the surface of your world.
Hint: You can get endstone for the portal in deeper layers of a Roguelike Dungeon.
Available resources: Abyssum, Palladium, Duranite, Draconium, Magma and Prosperity Ore.
The Nether
If you reached the Sand Moon, which is orbiting Mystical World Blue Giant, you can go on and finally visit the Nether. Guide how to do it is here:
Available resources: Prometheum, Cobalt, Ardite, Quartz, Magma and Valyrium.
Distant World Portal
For those who prefer portals rather than solid Warp Ship... there is a way how to build a portal from the Nether to the Distant World.
Just build a portal in the Nether, made of Chiseled Uranium Blocks and activate it using your loyal Golden Scythe.
Asteroid Mining
After visiting the moon, the Asteroid Mining Mission is available. Start by crafting the Satellite Builder and make in it some SATs using Chassis, Solar panels, Data Sticks, ID Chip and a Sensor
Keep the ID chip, put SATs in sat bays on top of a rocket.
Launch them. Put the chips in Sat Terminals. Start transferring the data into an Astrobody Data Processor (ADP).
Now Telescope, add some Distance Data into it. Used Motor and Lens do matter. Make Asteroid ID Chip and tune it in the Telescope to some Asteroid.
Fill the Asteroid Chip with ADP data. Put full chip in a harvesting rocket. With drills and storage space. Link it to the Rocket Monitor and off you go.
Available Resources
All the poor ores and ores available on your homeworld. But also:
With better Telescope, also UnderEnd ores could be available.
Gas Giant Mining
You can mine gases from any Gas Giant planet. To do that you must be on it's orbit, so you need a Warp Ship.
Harvester will drop down from a dock. Build Dock. Unmanned Vehicle Builder and Arms spreading left, right, up and over. No Floor.
Build Harvester with Tanks and Intakes. Must be facing away from the UV Builder.
Select Gas in the Harvester GUI, link it to the Monitoring station and off you go.
Following gases are available: oxygen, hydrogen, nitrogen, cloud seed, nutrient distillation and hootch.
Other Means
Later in the game, other means of obtaining resources might be available. It is only important to know that those are here and you should figure out yourself when you can have them.

page.title: How to make
page.p: Sometimes you just prefer someone's help... a guide how to do stuff, how was it meant.
Soo... when you don't know what next or you are lost, you can always look here to verify how the beta crew did it.
Sleeping Bag
So you are in the game... good, first thing: don't try to survive night. Make a sleeping bag.
For that you will need sticks, leaves and planks.
Most of it is easy, just the leaves, right?
Start with Food
Food is essential. Food looses saturation. It will take you 1000 hunger to forget you ate it. Collect new seeds and focus on variety.
Conserve energy, build stairs, do not jump. Start with collecting HarvestCraft seeds. Try Gardens, or brake Grass.
Bed, Furnace, Light
You don't need bed for sleeping, Sleeping Bag is enough for start.
But when you will get some wool make bed so you have respawnpoint in case of death.
For furnace dry some dirt. With 12 drying racks it takes 2 cycles to dry enough bricks for one furnace.
You can make Torches, Stone Torches or Harvestcraft candles and convert those directly into Tiny Torches.
Basic Tools and Armor
Tools are focusing on the Tinker's Construct mod. Start with Wood tools and then switch to Stone or Flint tools. If you will want something more, you will need a casting table.
You can start with Wooden or Stone armor.
When you want to switch to Leather, you can use Cloth instead.
Later on you can use combination of Hardened Leather and Obsidian.
Bees and Ropes
When you get some Wool, you can make Scoop. Break beehives with scoop and get Princesses, Drones and Combs.
Use the Combs to build Bee Houses. You can get Wax and later on Honey.
For ropes, you need Strings and Hemp Fibres. It is good to actually grow all three String-Like plants, Hemp, Cotton and String. Rope Coils replace String in most common recipes.
Charcoal and Creosole Oil
To get Charcoal you need Wood, Loam (mostly made of Clay) and an Igniter (Flint and Steel). Build a pyramit and set it on fire.
To make Creosote, you need the Coke Furnace. Creosote is important to get the Treated Wood, your next big step.
Better Food, Meat, Leather
Make fresh water, salt and kitchen tools.
Build Ground Traps and Fish Traps. Those will catch animals for you automatically. Just place them in water/ground and give them some Bait.Get Meat, Feathers, Leather and more.
Store and Transfer
Big leap up from Chests is a Storage Crate made using Treated Wood.
Water can be also collected in Bowls and Clay Buckets.
For storing liquids, use seared tanks. Later you can switch for Immersive Engineering Tanks and Barrels.
Starting Mining, Smeltery, Automation
Smeltery increases your gain by 1.5. Get Duranite as soon as possible to be able to cast ingots. It can be mined with Flint tools.
You can use Conveyor Belts for your first automation.
Gears, Rods and Plates
First machine parts will be casted. Use Stone Gear and Tough Tool Rod.
For First Plate check Small Plate Press, Rolling Machine or the Lead Plate receipt.
Carpenter and Thermionics
When you want to get into electronics you will need Carpenter and Thermionic Fabricator. sFirst electron tubes can be made in the smeltery.
You can use the Clockwork Engine to power your first machines.
Carpenter is bugged
Carpenter has small issue. Whenever you close and reopen the game it stops accept different liquids than: Water, Seed Oil and Honey.
That is why all important recipes have also Off-Carpenter variant suitable for auto-crafting.
Why to build a Ship
Some resources are much more common in different biomes then in the one you live in.
With a ship, you can find those biomes, build a mining camp there and carry your collected resources back to your base safely.
Every ship needs a Steering Wheel and a Steam Engine.
It is recommended to add Floaters to make your ship more stable and an Anchor to make it park more securely.
Take enough (Char)Coal for your ship. When it has no fuel it is dead in the water.
Power Production and Distribution
Before steel you have WindMills or use ClockWork Engines.
Store and transfer power the Industrial Engineering way.
With steel, you can use Improved Windmill, Water Wheel, Stirling Engines or Peat Fired Engines.
Use hammer to alter connection setting. Don't forget about Shift+Click
When you will have trouble connecting IE and Forestry, connect forestry directly to a Capacitor with no Connectors in between.
Regular Steel
Make Blast Furnace if you want to save material. The catch is you need Abbyssal stone, that means mine one of the boulders on the sea bed.
Make Arc Furnace instead if you have enough material and energy. You will need this one anyway in the near future.
MedKits
Medkits give you Regeneration. They are fast and quite cheap to make. You just have to set up a production line. You will need Protein liquifier (Food -> Protein) and an Industrial Bottler.
Fighting the Dungeon
Fight dungeons to get missing resources.
Use light to prevent spawning. Destroy spawners. Have Food, Medkits and a good weapon.
Use Razor Wires, Spikes or Turets to improve your chances.
UnderEnd Portal
3 Steps to get to UnderEnd:
Craft Faraday Armor, Build the Portal, Activate with the Scythe.
BIG WARNING about using portals. Read it and be prepared.
Cheaper Resources
Smeltery gives 1.5x more ores than furnace. Industrial crusher can give you 2x more than furnace.
But costs a lot of Steel.
Also try Tier 1 Mystical Seeds.
Mutating Bees
Mutate bees to get honeydew.With that get Tier 2 Mystical Seeds.
You will need Apiaries, Bee Frames, Analyzer and Honey Drops.
Mutate Meadows + Forest bees to get common. Check JEI how to get the Noble Bees.
Advanced Beebreading
For Tier 3 Mystical Seeds you need metallic propolis.
That means Metallic bees. Just remember that Hellish biome is also Mesa Bryce and Desert Hills.
Cheaper Gears
First step is the Industrial Press.
Second step will be the Rolling Machine and Lathe. But for that it is better to have proper electronics first.
Remember that there is also receipt for all basic Dusts if you don't have the Crusher
Industrial Potions
Industrial Mixer can make the brewing much cheaper.
Holo Projector
All Advanced Rocketry machines starting with the Arc Furnace can be easily built using the Holo Projector.
Proper Electronics
Build the Crystalizer. Make Transistors and Microchips there.
They are cheaper and quicker variants for the Electron Tubes.
Automatic Farm
Mini farm is 3x3x4. Power directly from capacitor.
Add platform. Supply dirt, water, fertilizer and seeds.
Program a circuit.
Crop farm (Bronze Tube) also supports Cotton and Magic Plants.
Automation with a Computer
Computer can be connected to a lot of extensions doing some item transfering and crafting for you.
If computer is not enough, Drone sure can do it.
Producing Rocket Fuel
Industrial Mixer + Tank: Water -> Potion -> Plain Potion.
Fermenter: Plain Potion + Fire Essence -> Fire Water.
Fermenter + Still: Water + Fruit -> Ethanol.
And Industrial Refinery: Fire Water + Ethanol -> Rocket Fuel.
Setting up Assembler
Precission Assembler is a crutial part of your technology base. Build it.
You will need it for your Space Suit. Also some Electronics recipes have their Assembler variant.
Getting Space Suit
Space suit is made in the Precission Assebler.
You need to add at least some oxygen tanks and pump in some O2.
To hold the oxygen, add some pressure tanks to your suit's chest.
Your Launch Site

Build rectangular platform bigger than the rocket. Add Structure Tower. Tower starts on the same level as the platform and goes up above the rocket. Place the Rocket Assembler next to the Platform, touching the platform with its edge.
Your Rocket to the Moon
For rocket you need Engines, Fuel Tanks, Seat and Guidance Computer with a blank Planet ID Chip inside.
Scan the rocket with the Rocket Assembler. It must have Acceleration >0 and be Ready to Lift Off.
Tricky Near Space
Where is no Oxygen is usually freezing cold.
No Torches or candles work in space.
Asteroids are islands above VOID. Be ready to fall.
Why the Moon
Easy enough for begginer. Learn to live in space.
Learn to build a base.
Get Meteorite and Karmesine. Make Restonia Crystals.
Space Armor
Steel and Magic Armor can be Air Tight.
Power Armor can be Air Tight. And upgradable, A LOT.
Hunting Rocks
Did you know that one Asteroid gives like 300 ore? The small one.
Your only source of Dilithium for now.
Getting Dilithium
Dilithium ore is not enough for your Warp Engine.
You must Crush it and Recrystalize It.
Asteroid Belt
Miners Paradise. Expect Death and Chaos... and Tones of Ores.
You need Manyullyn and Magma from there.
Excavating
Looking for better way how to get ores? You can make Steel Sheets now.
Try Core Sampler and Excavator.
Arc Smelting
First alternative to Smeltery.
Can make Steel and some Exotic alloys as well.
Try Electrical Steel and Redstone Alloy.
Bees #3
No more waiting. Gendustry is here. Try Mutatron.
You will need also Mutagen and Labware.
Warp Tricks
Ship needs Warp Core And Warp Controller.
Controller needs correct World Orb. Core needs Dilithium Crystals.
Don't get stuck on orbit with no crystals and mean to make rocket fuel.
Mining the Gas
Warp directly to orbit of the Gas Gian.
Send Drone, get Cloud Seed, Nitrogen and Nutrient Distillation.
Try the Bottler.
Moar Power
Try Zombie Generator or Combustion Engine.
Leaving Home
You must have on your ship: Lava World Orb, Dilithium.
Should also have: Rocket Fuel Production, Dilithium Production, Food.
So this is good bye. You are big now and you don't need guidebooks.
Good Luck.
